articles.headline: Donald Trump’s Threat to Close Door Reopens Old Wounds in Cuba
articles.snippet: In a post on Twitter, he said he would “terminate” the pact President Obama made if Cuba is unwilling to make “a better deal for the Cuban people.”
articles.abstract: In a post on Twitter, he said he would “terminate” the pact President Obama made if Cuba is unwilling to make “a better deal for the Cuban people.”
articles.lead_paragraph: HAVANA — It seemed like a new chapter in a long and troubled history.
articles.byline: By Damien Cave, Azam Ahmed and Julie Hirschfeld Davis

articles.headline: How Tour Guides Abroad Learn to Cater to Exotic Americans
articles.snippet: If you’re an American traveler fascinated by the foreign and exotic, understand this: Your tour guide probably finds you equally strange.
articles.abstract: If you’re an American traveler fascinated by the foreign and exotic, understand this: Your tour guide probably finds you equally strange.
articles.lead_paragraph: Don’t compliment an American’s girth. Answer their children’s questions. Fill your museum tour with fun facts.

articles.headline: Facebook Runs Up Against German Hate Speech Laws
articles.snippet: The social network’s efforts to placate German authorities provide a case study for its moves to combat fake news and hate speech online worldwide.
articles.abstract: The social network’s efforts to placate German authorities provide a case study for its moves to combat fake news and hate speech online worldwide.
articles.lead_paragraph: BERLIN — Yorai Feinberg was going about his daily routine this month when his social media feeds and cellphone began lighting up.
articles.byline: By Mark Scott and Melissa Eddy

articles.headline: Donald Trump Faces Obstacles to Resuming Waterboarding
articles.snippet: Federal law, international pressure and resistance from inside the C.I.A. stand in the way of Donald J. Trump using brutal interrogation tactics.
articles.abstract: Federal law, international pressure and resistance from inside the C.I.A. stand in the way of Donald J. Trump using brutal interrogation tactics.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — In the first few months of Donald J. Trump’s presidency, if recent history is any guide, intelligence officials will meet to discuss a terrorism suspect living abroad. This suspect might become the next target for the nation’s not-so-secret drone force. Or maybe, Mr. Trump’s advisers could decide, he is worth trying to capture.
articles.byline: By Matt Apuzzo and James Risen

articles.headline: News Outlets Rethink Usage of the Term ‘Alt-Right’
articles.snippet: Often used to describe a far-right, white nationalist movement and criticized by some as euphemizing extreme views, the label has emerged as a linguistic flash point.
articles.abstract: Often used to describe a far-right, white nationalist movement and criticized by some as euphemizing extreme views, the label has emerged as a linguistic flash point.
articles.lead_paragraph: When The Washington Post published a profile last week of Richard B. Spencer, a prominent leader of the so-called alt-right, readers were quick to respond. By Monday, the article had drawn more than 2,600 comments.

articles.headline: Dear President-Elect Trump: Here’s How to Fix Your Conflict-of-Interest Problem
articles.snippet: Consider hiring a corporate monitor, an independent overseer who will issue regular public reports about any possible instances of conflicts. We have just the person for you.
articles.abstract: Consider hiring a corporate monitor, an independent overseer who will issue regular public reports about any possible instances of conflicts. We have just the person for you.

articles.headline: Tom Price, Obamacare Critic, Is Trump’s Choice for Health Secretary
articles.snippet: The six-term Republican congressman from Georgia has led opposition to the Affordable Care Act.
articles.abstract: The six-term Republican congressman from Georgia has led opposition to the Affordable Care Act.
articles.lead_paragraph: WASHINGTON — If President-elect Donald J. Trump wanted a cabinet secretary who could help him dismantle and replace President Obama’s health care law, he could not have found anyone more prepared than Representative Tom Price, who has been studying how to accomplish that goal for more than six years.

articles.headline: For Bashar al-Assad, Winning the Syrian War May Lead to New Troubles
articles.snippet: If the Syrian president defeats the rebels, he may preside over an economic wasteland hampered by a low-level insurgency and facing a challenge to find financial aid to rebuild.
articles.abstract: If the Syrian president defeats the rebels, he may preside over an economic wasteland hampered by a low-level insurgency and facing a challenge to find financial aid to rebuild.
articles.lead_paragraph: BEIRUT, Lebanon — With the Syrian government making large territorial gains in Aleppo on Monday, routing rebel fighters and sending thousands of people fleeing for their lives, President Bashar al-Assad is starting to look as if he may survive the uprising, even in the estimation of some of his staunchest opponents.

articles.headline: Chapecoense Soccer Team’s Plane Crashes, Leaving Brazil Devastated
articles.snippet: Few survivors have been found among the 77 on the chartered flight taking the team to a game in Medellín, Colombia. The crash came as fans across Brazil had been reveling in the team’s performance.
articles.abstract: Few survivors have been found among the 77 on the chartered flight taking the team to a game in Medellín, Colombia. The crash came as fans across Brazil had been reveling in the team’s performance.
articles.lead_paragraph: RIO DE JANEIRO — After climbing the ranks of Brazilian soccer, the team was on its way to face one of its biggest tests yet: a chance to win the final of the Copa Sudamericana, an international competition for South American soccer.
articles.byline: By Simon Romero and Nicholas Casey

articles.headline: Earth Isn’t Doomed Yet. The Climate Could Survive Trump Policies.
articles.snippet: If the president-elect keeps nuclear plants going and maintains momentum for wind, solar, and shale energy, the United States could outdo its Paris pledges.
articles.abstract: If the president-elect keeps nuclear plants going and maintains momentum for wind, solar, and shale energy, the United States could outdo its Paris pledges.
articles.lead_paragraph: Is the battle to contain global warming now lost?
